questions-and-answers.explanation: The Java int keyword is a primitive data type. It is used to declare variables. It can also be used with methods to return integer type values. It can hold a 32-bit signed two's complement integer.

questions-and-answers.text: What is used to create tables in Java?
questions-and-answers.explanation: The double keyword is a data type that can store fractional numbers from 1.7e−308 to 1.7e+308.

questions-and-answers.text: The ________ tag is used to collect user input.
questions-and-answers.explanation: import is a Java keyword. It declares a Java class to use in the code below the import statement. Once a Java class is declared, then the class name can be used in the code without specifying the package the class belongs to.

questions-and-answers.text: Which symbol is used to comment out information in an HTML file?
questions-and-answers.explanation: Comments can be used to explain Java code, and to make it more readable. It can also be used to prevent execution when testing alternative code.Single-line comments start with two forward slashes (//).
